sentence.Network_en: They just cleave the stone along the cracks.
sentence.Network_cn: 他们就是顺着裂缝把石头劈开。

sentence.Network_en: The water is going to cleave a channel into the rock.
sentence.Network_cn: 水流将在大山中冲出一条峡谷来.

sentence.Network_en: The tribe cleave to their old belief even after the european arrive.
sentence.Network_cn: 即使在欧洲人到来之后,这些部落仍固守著它们古老的信仰.

derivation.yuyuan_name: Old English clēofan, of Germanic origin; related to Dutch klieven and German klieben
Old English cleofian, clifian, clīfan, of West Germanic origin; related to Dutch kleven and German kleben, also to clay and climb

entry.def: To cleave something means to split or divide it into two separate parts, often violently.

example.ex: They just cleave the stone along the cracks.
example.tran: 他们就是顺着裂缝把石头劈开。

entry.def: If someone cleaves to something or to someone else, they begin or continue to have strong feelings of loyalty towards them.

example.ex: She has cleaved to these principles all her life...
example.tran: 她这一辈子都恪守这些原则。

example.ex: He still clove to this ideal.
example.tran: 他仍然坚守着这个理想。

means.word_mean: 1. separate or cut with a tool, such as a sharp instrument;

sentences.sentence: "The water is going to cleave a channel into the rock"

means.word_mean: 3. come or be in close contact with; stick or hold together and resist separation;

auth_sentence.content: Even the new testament says men should cleave to their wives.
auth_sentence.res_content: Even the new testament says men should cleave to their wives.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: Even the new testament says men should cleave to their wives.

auth_sentence.content: The English translations cleave to an early stage of Freud's thought.
auth_sentence.res_content: The English translations cleave to an early stage of Freud's thought.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: The English translations cleave to an early stage of Freud's thought.

auth_sentence.content: More closely than ever did she cleave to the side of her mistress.
auth_sentence.res_content: More closely than ever did she cleave to the side of her mistress.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: More closely than ever did she cleave to the side of her mistress.

sentences.en: His spade cleaved the firm sand with a satisfying crunch.
sentences.cn: 他的锹凿开了坚实的砂土,发出令人舒心的嘎扎声。
